item.title: [GRA][Web Hosting] - Multiple Databases maintenance notification
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Nov 17, 07:00 UTC  -  Nov 27, 07:00 UTC

Oct 15, 00:40 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our databases offer in cluster eu012.

This may temporarily affect availability.
Start time: 17/11/2025 07:00 UTC
End time: 27/11/2025 15:00 UTC
Service impact: The duration of the unavailability of each database will range from one to five minutes.
Service improvement: As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be doing a maintenance on our databases offer.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [GRA][Web Hosting] - Cluster103 incident notification
item.description:
Nov 7, 18:29 UTC
Resolved - We are pleased to inform you that the incident affecting our Web Hosting offering on the cluster103 has been resolved.

Start time : 07/11/2025 10:00 UTC
End time : 07/11/2025 16:30 UTC
Root Cause : This incident was caused by a software issue.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 7, 12:44 UTC
Monitoring - Service has been fully restored since 07/11/2025 12:25 UTC. Monitoring remains active to ensure long-term stability.

Here are some supplementary details :

Start time : 07/11/2025 10:00 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Slowness was observed on Cluster103.
Customers Impact : Some customers were temporarily experiencing issues when trying to access and use their websites located in Cluster103.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 7, 12:31 UTC
Identified - We have determined the origin of the incident affecting our Web Hosting offering on the cluster103.

Here are some supplementary details :

Start time : 07/11/2025 10:00 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Slowness is being observed on Cluster103.
Customers Impact : Some customers are temporarily facing issue trying to access and use their websites located in Cluster103.
Root Cause : This incident is caused by a software issue.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

item.title: [GLOBAL][Web Hosting] - OVH Mail Migrator maintenance notification
item.description:
Nov 3, 13:30 UTC
Completed - We would like to inform you that the maintenance on our is now completed.
All services are operational.

Thank you for your patience throughout this maintenance.

Nov 3, 07:30 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Oct 29, 16:53 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on OVH Mail Migrator service.

Start time : 03/11/2025 07:30 UTC
End time : 04/11/2025 18:00 UTC
Service impact : OVH Mail Migrator API need an extra header to continue to work
Service improvement : We're making some changes to the OVH Mail Migrator (https://omm.ovh.net) API.

Starting November 3rd, 2025, customers who use our API will need to add an extra HTTP header when creating new migrations or projects.
This header is called X-Ovh-Use-Obsolete-Api and it should be set to 1.

If you don't add this header, you'll receive an error message saying that the API is deprecated and will be removed on November 24th, 2025.
The error message will also point you to a webpage where you can find more information about the changes.

The reason for this change is that we're introducing a new version of the API, called API v3, which will be available on November 24th, 2025.

This new API will replace the current one, and you'll need to use it to create new migrations, projects, or file uploads.

If you want to learn more about the new API, you can visit https://omm.ovh.net/NewApi from November 3rd, where you'll find more information about its structure and the required headers.

Thank you for your understanding.
